instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 20v 100ma
threads.message: battery board was corroded so I didn't bother plugging it in. there was corrosion around <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7401</TRANSISTOR>. haven't replaced anything yet. board refuses to boot with by-3200 cable, not sure if the battery charging circuit would stop boot or if there is another underlying issue. sits at 20v 100ma. I did try plugging a battery in and it went up to 500ma so it appears to be charging? not sure what to check next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 20v 100ma
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at all big coils of the board.
Liquid sign near <TRANSISTOR>Q7401</TRANSISTOR> is not good at all.
PCH could be easy damaged...
